reviewText: Very disappointing.  Most of the clips were of older comedians and the humor was not very good.  I had hoped there would be more of the later comedians.
DVD would not play, had to return.

very disappointed. I love Benny Hill, Monty Python, Peter Cook and Peter sellers. I love "Britcoms". There is very little interesting in these performances. Most of the people in these clips are unknown and for good reason. Stick to the classics.

I thought I was buying a tape with full shows. This is highlights like they show as commercials to sell the best of series. It's okay if like these things, I just thought I would be seeing full shows of those show on the cover.

Terrible.

First of all, if this is actually 3 hours, it's only because of the interviews with people who aren't funny.

Second of all, I never saw one bit of John Cleese in this DVD. And Benny Hill only had about 45 seconds - and it was taken out of context, which made it completely unfunny.

It's a lot of people you've never heard of even if you did follow British comedy (which I have from the early 70s.) The quality of the DVD and the content is not worth your time. Not worth anyone's time. I might give it to the worst of our prisoners as a punishment. But that might be called cruel and unusual.
